author: Staff Reporter
text:
A group of alumni of Rosary Matriculation School, who were in class IV in 1955-56, came together after 60 years to relive those good old days.

Prabha Sridevan, former judge of Madras High Court, who initiated the alumni meeting said, “I still remember how we would walk past our headmistress’ room quietly and then, start whispering. We were reminiscing about those moments. When you age, perhaps, you want to see and meet those you grew up with,” she said.

N. Ravi, director of Kasturi and Sons Limited, took part in the alumni meet. Others who attended include Malathi Subramanian, Rama Vijayakumar, Umayal Narayanan, Lakshmi Kumar, L. Lakshman, Nagaraj, R. Shanker, Ravi Narayanaswami and Girija Shanker.

C.R.L. Narasimhan, an alumnus of the school, said, “Remembering the past was taken to mean that members will exchange information in an informal manner on how they have fared in the intervening 60 years.”

Though the meeting was planned many months ago, it had to be rescheduled twice owing to the rains, he said. “A visit to the school premises as it existed then — it has since shifted to an adjoining building — evoked feelings of nostalgia. Some of us could actually recognise the classrooms,” he added.

title: 60 years later, a walk down memory lane
